entry.title: Re: How to Define Posting Rules-Period Selection field？
entry.content:
Navigate to the Rule Group: Go to your consolidation environment and find the transaction for maintaining Rule Groups (e.g., often found under Consolidation Settings > Rules for Automatic Postings > Manage Rules for Automatic Postings > How to Define Rule Groups).

Select Your Rule Group: Find and open the Rule Group that contains your posting rule Z99.

Check the "Processing Mode" Field: In the Rule Group configuration, there will be a key field called Processing Mode or similar. This field must be set to YTD - Year to Date.

Save the Change: Save the updated Rule Group

According to KBA 2903679, there is no customer project or internal project displayed in app "Mass Changes to project". Community discussions have raised this question, but so far, SAP Help and Fiori Apps Reference Library do not explicitly provide such a status list; restrictions might depend on business rules, project profiles, or current processing status like locked, closed, or technically completed.

entry.title: Taming the X12 856 message in SAP Integration Advisor: A Step-by-Step Guide
entry.content:
Introduction

In customer support we often get requests how to handle X12 856 (Ship Notice/Manifest) messages. In a previous blog post we explained how we can handle X12 856 messages as source messages with the help of pre-transformations. In this article we show the reverse scenario where the X12 856 message is the target message. The biggest challenge there is the correct ordering of the HL segments according to the packaging hierarchy and the determination of their hierarchical ID numbers. Currently, this can only done with a custom post-processing XSLT script which is explained in details.

Scenario

We use the reverse scenario of our earlier blog post: Assume you have a source MIG based on a cXML ShipNoticeRequest which shall be mapped to an X12 856 based target MIG. Let's start with the source MIG:

Structure of source MIG (cXML ShipNoticeRequest)

There is not so much to mention. The important parts for our scenario are the ShipNoticePortion group, which corresponds to the orders, the ShipNoticeItem group, which contains the line items of the shipment, and the Packaging group, which describes the packing for each item. These are the parts which needs to be mapped to the different hierarchy levels of the HL segments in the target X12 856 message, which looks like the following:

Structure of target MIG (cXML ShipNoticeRequest)

Note that we used here Integration Advisor's qualification feature to distinguish the different hierarchy levels: We have in total four duplications of the HL segment, each is qualified by a different value of element 735 (Hierarchical Level Code): S for shipment (corresponds to the root of the source cXML message), O for order (corresponds to the ShipNoticePortion of the source), P for pack (corresponds to Package), and I for item (corresponds to ShipNoticeItem). But if we exactly do these mappings:

  • ShipNoticeRequest -> HL[S]
  • ShipNoticePortion -> HL[O]
  • Package -> HL[P]
  • ShipNoticeItem -> HL[I],

First naive mapping attempt

and simulate it with the attached payload, we see the following issues in the resulting payload:

  1. The hierarchical ID number (field 628) is missing.
  2. the parent hierarchical ID number (field 734) is missing.
  3. The HL groups are sorted according to their type and not according to their hierarchical order.
  4. The packages are duplicated, we see four instances of them, although the source cXML message contains only three of them:

Actual payload after naive mapping

The expected payload should look something like this:

Expected target payload

Here each child element is below its corresponding parent element, has a unique continuous number, and a reference to its parent.

Solution

This mapping challenge unfortunately can't solved with Integration Advisor's core capabilities, however, it's still possible to use Integration Advisor for the main mapping and use an additional XSLT script to generate the expected output. But before we explain the XSLT script, we need to add some additional mappings to the naive mapping explained above so that the XSLT script can do its work:

      • Create a group-to-leaf mapping (see also Group to Leaf Mapping)  from ShipNoticePortion to HL[735=O]/HL/628 with the following XSLT function:
<xsl:sequence select="$nodes_in/ShipNoticePortion/@position"/>

Note: This is not the final content of the 628 field, but serves as a temporary ID to distinguish the different orders (ShipNoticePortions) in the intermediate result. You could also use other unique IDs of the order like the orderID. Here the ID is just the position of the order in the list of all ShipNoticePortions.

      • Create another group-to-leaf mapping from ShipNoticePortion to HL[735=P]/HL/734 with the same XSLT function:
<xsl:sequence select="$nodes_in/ShipNoticePortion/@position"/>​

If you used another ID in step 1 you have to use the same here as well. Please note that this mapping line goes to one level deeper than the first one (to HL[735=P] instead to HL[735=O]. And the target node is 734 instead of 628.

      • Create a mapping from ShipNoticePortion/ShipNoticeItem/Packaging/ShippingContainerSerialCode to HL[735=P]/HL/628. Like in step 1 this is needed to uniquely identify the packages and is only a temporary ID, which later will be replaced by the final value.
      • Map the same field (ShipNoticePortion/ShipNoticeItem/Packaging/ShippingContainerSerialCode) also to HL[735=I]/HL/734 (again one level deeper and a different target field).
      • And finally map the nodes ShipNoticePortion/OrderReference/orderID and ShipNoticePortion/ShipNoticeItem/lineNumber to HL[735=I]/HL/628. Again we need a unique ID for each item, which is the concatenation of orderID and lineNumber in this case. Again also other alternatives are possible.

These mapping lines are only those relevant for the construction of the right target structure. Obviously you need to add the mapping lines for the right content, which is omitted here to reduce the complexity.

With these mappings we get a target payload like the previous one, but with the small difference that each hierarchy item now has an identifier, which could be used in a post-processing XSLT script to sort them according to their hierarchy as well as to eliminate duplicates, and a reference to its parent item:

Target payload after IA mapping

Here we show the XML version of the target payload, because that is what is created by the XSLT mapping generated by the Integration Advisor. Although it's possible to download the flat file version in Integration Advisor, the final conversion from XSLT to flat file is done by the corresponding EDI flowstep of Cloud Integration. And that's why we can use an additional XSLT step in our Cloud Integration pipeline (or in the custom post-processing Integration Flow, if you use TPM) to transform it to the right structure. 

This can be done with the attached XSLT (note, that you have to change the namespace prefix of the root node to xsl to make it work, due to some security restrictions, I couldn't upload the correct file). If you apply it to the previous result you get this XML:

As you can see the different hierarchy levels are in the right order, each children is under its corresponding parent and has a continuous number, and also the duplicate is eliminated. Furthermore, each element has the right reference to its parent in the D_734 field. If you convert it to an EDI flat file, you will get exactly the payload shown at the beginning of this article.

Note also that the script can be applied to the IA version of the payload as well as to the Cloud Integration version. If you use an Integration Flow like this, this means that you can add it before or after the "X12 Post-processing" step. It will work in the same way in both cases. If you use TPM, the optional post-processing in the interchange step (see point 37 in Trading Partner Agreement and Understanding the ProcessDirect Adapter) always works on the Cloud Integration version of the payload. But also there the XSLT script is usable. You need to build an Integration Flow with a ProcessDirect Adapter as inbound channel. This Integration Flow needs only one XSLT mapping step which uses the XSLT script.

Conclusion

With the attached XSLT script you can now create a correct X12 856 message with Integration Advisor. It should work for most of the cases independent of the required hierarchy levels (and also some similar ones with small modifications). It neither depends on the exact source message, therefore it should be usable also for scenarios with other source messages. The only condition which needs to be fulfilled is that to each hierarchy item a unique identifier can be assigned which is mapped to the D_628 and D_734 fields as in our example. If you have similar scenarios for which this script does not work, let me know, maybe we can find a solution together. I would be happy to hear from you.

entry.title: Re: SAP Public Cloud Intrastat Conversion of Regions
entry.content:
Hello @DanailKamenov 

Thank you for your question. I hope this still provides some vital details.

In SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud, the setup for Intrastat reporting is streamlined compared to on-premise. Some customizing options like defining separate “administrative regions” and mapping them to general regions are not available in CBC.

Here are some key points for Public Cloud I suggest to take note of:

  1. For designated regions: Only the delivered general regions from business partner / address master data are used in Intrastat reporting. There is no separate customizing for Intrastat administrative regions in Public Cloud unlike on-premise.
  2. When using Intrastat Reporting Apps: The apps Prepare Intrastat Declaration, Dispatches (F4851) and Arrivals (F4850) take the region of destination or origin from the address data. These apps expect the official region codes in the format required by the local legislation.
  3. How to handle your case (3-letter codes vs. 2-digit codes): Since you cannot create a mapping layer in Public Cloud, the region codes in the Business Partner address master data must directly match the Intrastat reporting requirement (three-letter codes in your case). Existing general regions with two-digit codes cannot be deleted, but they also do not need to be used. You can maintain the correct 3-letter codes as additional region entries and assign them to the relevant business partner addresses.
  4. SAP recommends; not to create new “administrative regions” like in on-premise; instead, define the required general regions with the correct codes for reporting. Leave the old 2-digit entries unused (they remain in the system but have no effect if not assigned to master data).

 

These references will provide further guidance:

Prepare Intrastat Declaration

Business Partner Address Data – Regions

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Quality Heat Number Flow in Public Cloud
entry.content:
Hi Raj,

in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud, this type of requirement is possible but needs to follow the extensibility framework. Below you will find steps to guide you:

  1. Where you can capture the value
  • In Usage Decision, you can add a Custom Field via Custom Fields and Logic app.
  • Business Context: Inspection Lot Usage Decision (or related QM contexts).
  • This allows the user to record the “Quality Heat Number” during usage decision.
  1. How you can make the field flow to stock apps
  • The Multiple Stock app and Stock Single Material (which has replaced MMBE) only display fields available in material document or stock tables.
  • To pass your custom value into these stock apps, you must:
    • Ensure you extend the relevant Business Context in Inventory Management (e.g. Material Document Item).
    • Make use of Custom Logic to transfer the value from QM into the material document posting that updates stock.
  • This way, your “Quality Heat Number” becomes part of stock characteristics.
  1. There are also some alternative approaches
  • If you only need this for reporting, it might be easier to:
    • Store the Heat Number in the inspection lot or usage decision.
    • Create a Custom CDS View joining Inspection Lot plus Material Document plus Stock.
    • Expose this in a custom report or KPI app in Fiori.
  • This will avoid trying to modify standard stock apps and keeps your solution upgrade-stable.
  1. Please note the limitations in Public Cloud
  • You cannot directly inject custom fields into all standard stock apps like Display Stock Multiple Materials.
  • Instead, use Custom Fields (Inventory Mgmt. context) plus Custom Logic for mapping plus Custom Analytical Reports if display in MMBE-like apps is not supported.

The following references will provide further support:

Extensibility in SAP S/4HANA Cloud

Business Contexts for Custom Fields

Material Document Item  Custom Field Extensibility

I hope this provides the right guidance.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Integration of Work instructions from S4-Public to SA...
entry.content:
Hi @RodoFK 

Thank you for your question. we apologise for the delayed response and hope the following details will provide some help.

In S/4HANA Public Cloud, the way you handle work instructions for SAP Digital Manufacturing is different compared to ERP/on-premise, where PRT-type documents could be directly used.

Here are some key differences vs. on-premise

  • In ERP/on-premise, Production Resource/Tool type = “Document” was commonly used to attach work instructions to routing/operation.
  • In S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, PRTs of type “Document” are not available. Instead, the supported way is to use Document Management System (DMS) integrated with routings/operations.

Here is how you can include work instructions in Public Cloud

  1. Firstly, upload Work Instructions as Documents
    • Use the app Manage Documents in S/4HANA Cloud.
    • Store your work instruction for example PDF, Word, image in the DMS.
  2. Then, assign Document to Master Data
    • Assign the document to the operation in the routing or production version using the Manage Routings or Process Routings app.
    • This replaces the on-premise PRT-document approach.
  3. Integration with SAP Digital Manufacturing
    • When the production order is sent to SAP Digital Manufacturing, the document reference (work instruction) attached at operation level is transferred.
    • In SAP DM, the work instruction is then available for operators in Pod Work Instruction Viewer.

The following references provide further details

Integration of S/4HANA Cloud with SAP Digital Manufacturing Work Instructions

Manage Documents App

Assigning Documents to Routings/Operations in S/4HANA Cloud

 

I hope this provides the right guidance.

Best regards

Chris

I think intuitively one would expect that from the moment we are using Test Plans, only Test Cases belonging to a Test Plan would be considered for execution. On the other hand, I can also imagine someone wondering why one of the Test Cases disappeared and was not tested, if we forget to add one of the Test Cases to a Test Plan.

It's a bit of a difficult design decision, especially when trying to make things as flexible as possible, but I would suggest maybe a checkbox option for a project, to decide between Test Plans being mandatory or not, if the checkbox is activated, only Test Cases included in a Test Plan would be considered for execution and show up. Also a warning if some Test Cases were forgotten would make sense maybe.

Cheers!

entry.title: Re: Create a valuation grouping
entry.content:
Hello @Santiago_Barrero 

Thank you for your question.  We apologise for the delayed response. 

SSCUI for Valuation Grouping

In SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud, valuation grouping is maintained through SSCUI 102353 Define Valuation Control.

  • Here you can activate valuation grouping and assign valuation areas (plants) to valuation grouping codes.
  • Valuation grouping codes like 0001, 0002 are then used in automatic account determination.

SSCUIs for Automatic Account Determination

After defining the valuation grouping, you need to maintain the account determination customizing:

  • SSCUI 100297 Configure Automatic Postings (MM)
    • This is where you assign G/L accounts for transactions for example BSX, WRX, GBB based on chart of accounts, valuation grouping code, and account grouping.
  • SSCUI 100374 Define Account Grouping for Movement Types if additional groupings are needed.

Here are steps to Perform

  1. Go to SSCUI 102353 Define Valuation Control
    • Create/activate valuation grouping code .
    • Assign your valuation area (plant or company code) to this code.
  2. Go to SSCUI 100297, Configure Automatic Postings
    • Maintain the G/L account determination for your new valuation grouping code (0002).
  3. Optionally, you can check movement type groupings via SSCUI 100374 if you need different account grouping keys.

Here are references for more details:

Automatic Account Determination in S/4HANA Cloud

SSCUI 100297 – Configure Automatic Postings

I hope this provides the right guidance.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: 🟣 From Insights to Action: Achieve process by combining Process Mining, Task Mining & Automation
entry.content:
Discover how developers can harness the power of SAP Signavio, SAP Build, and KYP.ai (SAP partner) to transform process insights into automated actions. This session walks through a real-world scenario – from identifying process inefficiencies and specific tasks with big automation potential to deploying intelligent automation – using task-level analytics, prompt-based development, and custom Joule skill creation in Joule Studio.
We will follow a practical story flow and you will be able to learn how to implement such end-to-end scenario in your own environment.
 
Speakers
  • Evgeniy
  • Manuel Taechl

 
Evgeniy is a Senior Product Manager for SAP Build with more than 10 years of experience in implementing SAP solutions and improving them together with the customers. Evgeniy worked as a presales specialist and implementation consultant covering wide variety of data warehousing, analytics solutions, and process-centric tools. Being a passionate enthusiast and evangelist of Enterprise Automation topic, Evgeniy is driving strategic product management, customer adoption and go-to-market activities within the SAP Build organization.
 
Manuel Taechl is a Director of Product Management at SAP Signavio. He leads the vision, strategy, and execution for ecosystem integrations across the SAP Signavio product portfolio. He focuses on building a thriving technology partner ecosystem and fostering integrations with other SAP solutions. This includes developing a robust API portfolio to empower customer, partner, and internal developers to extend and integrate SAP Signavio products.

entry.title: SAP PaPM Cloud Standard Model: What’s New as of 2025-09-01?
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community members!

We’re excited to share the latest updates in SAP Profitability and Performance Management Cloud (SAP PaPM Cloud) Standard Model. This release introduces new roles, enhanced data management capabilities, and flexible feature toggling to improve your modeling and administrative experience.

 

I. Modeling Screen

We are introducing a new role in the SAP Profitability and Performance Management Cloud – Standard Model for the modeling screen called MODELING_RUN. Similarly with MODELING_READ role, the users with MODELING_RUN will not be able to perform changes in the Modeling screen, but users with this role can activate and run functions and execution activity in the process template level in the Modeling.

Additionally, the users with the MODELING_RUN role can access the Data Management Screen to view data but cannot edit it. The available options include downloading data, working with Layout, and using the Settings section to display the technical fields or toggle Pivot mode on and off.

To use this role, you need to update the instance in BTP with the new JSON code that contains the new role. You can find more information on how to perform this action on the Service Instance - Sample JSON File

After this, the MODELING_RUN role will be available in the Roles tab. Now you can create a role collection and assign it later to a designated use.

For more information, you may check the Role Templates in Standard Model.

 

II. Administration | Settings Screen

Let me walk you through the new section in the Settings screen, the Optional Features Settings! The Optional Features Settings gives administrators a way to activate or deactivate optional features of tenant for the users to explore the new features early in a certain period before the optional features are released globally.

Administrators will be notified through an in-app banner, which will include information about the new feature and a link to the SAP Community blog post, where they can read the published articles about the new features.

 To activate an optional feature:

  1. Go to the Menu > Administration > Settings screen via:
    1. Home page information banner link
    2. Menu > Administration > Settings
  2. Scroll down to Optional Features Settings section, click the toggle button for the feature you want to activate.
  3. Choose Save.

After successfully activating an optional feature/s, all users will receive a notification banner regarding the new available feature/s on their home page, including the SAP Community blog post link. Users can now explore the new activated feature.

Note: To view additional information about the feature, hover the cursor over the info tooltip.

In any case that administrators would want to switch back to the old features, we also have the option to deactivate the optional feature temporarily. At this moment, administrators will also have the chance to provide feedback on the feature.

To deactivate an optional feature:

  1. Go to the Settings screen via Menu > Administration > Settings.
  2. Under Optional Features Settings section, click on the toggle button of the feature you want to deactivate.
  3. After toggling, the system displays a feedback prompt. Choose either Submit Feedback or Skip Feedback to continue.
  4. Choose Save to apply your changes.

Once an optional feature is globally released, it will be automatically removed from the Settings screen.

Note: If no optional features are currently available, administrators will see the following message in the Settings screen

 

III. In-App Notification

There is a new notification method in SAP PaPM Cloud SM, this time it can be found in application level where users will also be notified apart from the email notifications that Performer and Reviewer teams are getting when Submitting, Approving or Submitting, and Initializing an activity or process. This In-App notification can be enabled via:

  1. Menu
  2. User Preferences
  3. Enable or Disable ‘Push Notifications’

After this switch is enabled, users part of Performer or Reviewer will now be notified via the bell icon on the upper-right side of the application.

For more information visit: Notification Settings

 

IV. Environment Screen (main) and Content Management

Another exciting addition in SAP PaPM Cloud SM application is the extended environment access level security which can now be maximized when creating, editing, and copying an environment in Environment Screen and Import any environment in Content Management.

For details you can read the blogpost SAP PaPM Cloud Standard Model: Extended Environment Access Level Functionality.

 

V. Managing Default Data Representation (Modeling and Process Management screens)

SAP Profitability and Performance Management Cloud Standard Model modelers and process users can now conveniently set a default data representation or view in their input/output activities in Process Templates and Process Instances so they can immediately see the default view upon viewing input/output data.

To set the default data representation in Modeling and Process Management screens:

  1. In your modeling area, go to your existing Process Template > Input/Output Activity.
  2. In the General properties, scroll down to Default Data Representation section.
  3. Click on the dropdown and select an option:
    1. Pivot Off – If this is chosen, the data will be presented in Pivot Off view by default in Show screen.
    2. Pivot On – If this is chosen, the data will be presented in Pivot On view by default in Show screen.

       

  4. Choose Save to apply the changes.
  5. Choose the Manage Data button to view data.

To set the default data representation in Process Management screen:

  1. In the Process Management screen, go to your existing Process Instance > Input/Output Activity.
  2. In the General properties, scroll down to Default Data Representation section.
  3. Click on the dropdown and select an option:
    1. Pivot Off – If this is chosen, the data will be presented in Pivot Off view by default in Show screen.
    2. Pivot On – If this is chosen, the data will be presented in Pivot On view by default in Show screen.

       

  4. Choose Save to apply the changes.
  5. Choose the Manage Data button to view data.

Note: The default data representation defined from Process Template level will be reflected in the Process Instance input/output activity which can still be updated in the Process Instance level. 

 

VI. Data Management screen 

With the newest update, download options in Pivot ON of Data Management screen have been enhanced. Along with the visible dataset, you can now download the complete dataset, giving you full access to all the data in just one click. The dataset can also be exported in any file format that has been defined in the Modeling screen, giving you full flexibility.

Steps to download the complete dataset:

  1. Open the Data Management screen
  2. Enable Pivot mode
  3. Click the Download button in the header
  4. In the Data Download window, select Complete dataset
  5. (Optional) Choose the desired file format (as defined in Modeling screen)
  6. Click Download for the preferred XLSX or CSV format

Thank you for reading this blog post! We hope these new features enhance your experience with SAP PaPM Cloud Standard Model. To explore previous updates, check out the tag PaPMCloudWhatsNew. Stay tuned for future What's New posts!

entry.title: 🟣 Roles and Authorization in SAP Build Process Automation: A Developer’s Guide
entry.content:
Effective access control is essential for secure and scalable process automation. This session provides a practical understanding of roles and authorization in SAP Build Process Automation. We’ll explore how pre-delivered role collections can be applied effectively, how shared environments enable granular control over runtime artifacts and API access, and how project-level authorization secures design-time assets. Together these elements form a cohesive and scalable authorization model that supports secure process automation development in SAP BTP. Attendees will leave with insights to implement robust access control in their own automation projects.

Speaker

  • Seshadri Sreenivas Ramanarayanan

Seshadri Sreenivas Ramanarayanan is the Lead Product Manager of SAP Build Process Automation and an SAP PRESS author. With over 18 years of service at SAP, he brings a wealth of experience in business process management & business rule management domain to his role. A seasoned speaker at conferences like TechEd, Sapphire, and bpmNext, Seshadri is known for his insights on process automation and digital transformation.

entry.title: Deep Dive and Experience Sharing into SAP Joule for Developers(J4D)
entry.content:
Disclaimer: This blog is not written by any LLM.

Well, to start with, Joule for Developers, let us understand what it is?

Many people have a misconception that Joule for Developers or J4D is just an ABAP AI capability. But it is much more beyond ABAP. Joule for Developers(J4D) is collective name for the AI-powered design-time capabilities across SAP Build and ABAP

It includes new and existing features enabled by Joule in:

  1. SAP Build Code
  2. SAP Build Apps
  3. SAP Build Process Automation
  4. ABAP in SAP BTP and S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

These capabilities help developers build faster, code smarter, and automate better. Is that true? I will my honest opinion for some of them.

I have personally worked on SAP Build Code and Joule for Developers, ABAP AI. I started with a lot of ambiguity and finally I made a mark that I could now explain it to our customers and users.

SAP Build Code, has evolved through multiple iterations and seems it is still evolving. 

  • Created Fiori element app using Image
  • Created a series of projects with prompts
  • Created test data

With ABAP AI, I could create a report with the suggestions popping up in run time and that too contextually aware code prompts also known to be predictive code completion feature. We called it Ghost Code. But trust me sometimes they are really good too. 

I see the ABAP and CDS unit scripts getting generated in no time. It was good again on this parameter. 

Code explain, well I created small projects, hence feel it is good to have comments. But the true colors will be visible when you look at the repository of thousands lines of code written by someone and you have no clue of what it is. Using your skills you debug the code to understand what each block/function is doing. It is a life saver in this scenario.

Well this will be an evolving document, where I will keep updating my reviews on each of these services mentioned. Stay tuned!

You can refer to the following blogs in this context:

https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/unlock-sap-joule-for-developers-claim-your-free-access-today/ba-p/14183158

entry.title: Re: Different picking locations on 1 Purchase Order
entry.content:
Hello @Eric_SAUTOT64 

Thank you for your question and apologies for the late response.

Following up on your request regarding the ability to assign different picking locations for items within the same Purchase Order, please find below the clarification for SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud.

Here is the current behaviour observed

  • FO-level changes: Attempting to change the source location directly in the Freight Order results in an error. This is because, in Public Cloud, the Freight Order derives its source location from the Purchase Order item, and direct modification at FO level is not supported.
  • Header-level Goods Supplier partner: If the Goods Supplier (GS) partner is maintained only at PO header level, this assignment is inherited by all PO items. Consequently, all items generate Freight Units/Freight Orders with the same location.

Here is the recommended standard approach

To support different picking locations within the same PO:

  1. First is to maintain Goods Supplier Partner at Item Level
    • In the Partners tab of each PO item, assign the correct Goods Supplier partner/location.
    • Each item will then carry its own source location.
    • During Freight Unit building, these item-specific locations flow correctly into the Freight Order.
  2. Then, ensure master data preparation
    • Ensure that the supplier (Business Partner) master data contains the different physical locations required.
    • These can be maintained as distinct addresses under the same supplier BP.
    • When creating the PO, select the appropriate GS partner for each item.

Alternatively you can consider the following

  • If the supplier confirms shipping locations only after PO creation, these updates can be handled by:
    • Supplier confirmation via Ariba à updating PO item GS partner.
    • Or, where necessary, you can use a custom BAdI to update partner assignments after supplier response.
  • Adding a custom field at PO item level is not sufficient, since Transportation Management integration only recognizes standard partner roles (such as Goods Supplier).

These references provide more details.

Assign Goods Supplier Partner in PO Item (S/4HANA Cloud)

Freight Unit Building from Purchase Orders

 

I hope this provides the right guidance.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Joule provisioning with SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition using Cloud Integration Automation service
entry.content:
We are happy to announce that Joule integration with SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition is now available in Cloud Integration Automation service as one of the integration scenarios.

Joule, being the next generation AI copilot from SAP, it is important for SAP to make Joule provisioning and setup easy and automated for its customers. Joule is available for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition within RISE with SAP. The existing manual integration process is complex, time consuming and the whole integration process takes weeks if not months, but thanks to the automation capabilities provided by the Cloud Integration Automation service, the Joule integration set up is now much simpler and faster.

By leveraging the Cloud Integration Automation service (offered as a service within BTP) at no additional cost, setting up Joule in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition is now considerably faster, simpler, and more reliable. This service allows for the automation of number of integration steps, significantly reducing the overall integration effort for SAP customers.

Customer can leverage ready-to-use guided workflows, automations, and role-specific execution to simplify and accelerate the entire Joule integration.

Involved Components

The different component involved are 

  • SAP BTP
  • SAP Cloud Connector
  • SAP S/4HANA PCE
  • SAP Cloud Identity Services

Though the Joule integration process is complex, the Cloud Integration Automation service is ideally positioned to connect Joule with SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition for these reasons:

  • Cloud Integration Automation service being an AI enabled task orchestration tool.
  • Out of the box standardized guided workflows and role-based execution.
  • Integrated parameter management
  • Hybrid approach, where in it can automate the steps and provide a documentation which cannot be automated.
  • Cloud Integration Automation service comes with no additional cost and the service is available in SAP BTP.
  • Cloud Integration Automation service can provide the system landscape information hence bringing greater visibility of the entire customer landscape

The Joule integration with SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition can be broadly classified into following:

1) SAP BTP Configuration

Tasks:

Task Name:

Automated / Manual

Creating new BTP sub account

Automated

Adding the entitlements to the subaccount for Joule, Cloud Identity Service and Work Zone

Automated

Enabling Cloud Foundry

Automated

Establish trust with Cloud Identity Services

Automated

Activate SAP Work Zone, Connectivity service and create service keys

Automated

Activate Cloud Identity Service

Automated

Disable IDP and Trust domain.

Automated

2) SAP Cloud Connector configuration 

Tasks:

Task Name

Automated / Manual

Add subaccount in your SAP Cloud Connector

Automated

Create mapping virtual to internal systems (HTTP)

Automated

Create mapping virtual to internal systems (RFC)

Automated

Add resource path for HTTP & RFC

Automated

3) BTP Destinations

Tasks:

Task Name

Automated / Manual

Create Work Zone design time destination

Automated

Create Work Zone runtime destination

Automated

Retrieving nomination via the SAP Cloud Connector

Automated

Create Navigation Service

Automated

RFC destination for identity provisioning

Automated

Navigational and transactional capabilities

Automated

4) SAP S/4HANA PCE

Tasks:

Task Name

Automated / Manual

Activate SICF service

Fully automated

Add Role

Manual

Create catalog in Fiori launchpad designer

Manual

Create new role in role maintenance

Manual

Schedule jobs to expose contents

Manual

5) Joule activation

Tasks:

Task Name

Automated / Manual

Run Booster from BTP cockpit

Manual

6) SAP work zone configuration

Tasks:

Task Name

Automated / Manual

Create content provider

Manual

7) SAP Cloud Identity services

Tasks:

Automated / Manual

Trust the domain

Automated

Setup source system

Automated

Setup target system

Automated

Running the job

Manual

Joule Provisioning Scenario using Cloud Integration Automation service

To kickstart Joule integration for your SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition, simply click on Joule Provisioning scenario in the Cloud Integration Automation service as highlighted in the below screen shot.

To conclude, Cloud Integration Automation service with its automation and workflow capabilities not only made the Joule integration easy and automated but also helps in accelerating the Joule adoption in the private cloud space.

If you want to know more about the Cloud Integration Automation service find related links and blogs below.

 What is Cloud Integration Automation Service? | SAP Help Portal

entry.title: Call for Beta Testing the SAP Business Client 8.10
entry.content:
The next major release of SAP Business Client is planned for Q1, 2026 and will be shipped as usual together with SAP GUI for Windows 8.10. *

For the upcoming version 8.10 we have integrated a lot of customer feedback. To get your feedback we are currently packaging a version that we can share with selected customers and partners as part of a closed beta program.

*In parallel to the SAP Business Client 8.10 SAP beta program, a beta program for SAP GUI 8.10 is conducted. The Test and Evaluation Agreement will be valid for both frontend programs. You can find more information on  Beta program SAP GUI for Windows (link is going to work as soon as the GUI blog post will be published, might take a couple of hours)

How to apply?
We are looking for approximately 10 participants to actively test and provide feedback. If you are interested, please simply mail me at:

sandra.thimme@sap.com

Please include:

  • Customer number
  • Contact name

This data will only be used to organize the program. The number of participants is limited. Only customers who are willing to actively test the features listed below should participate. The beta will be open for 90 days.

If you were selected for the beta program we will  send you a Test and Evaluation Agreement (TEA). Once this is returned to us, we will provide details of how to get, install, and configure the Business Client test version and use the new features.

What can you expect?

  • Horizon theming

 

 

 

 

 

 

  • Horizon custom theming for Cloud and Hybrid environments as well, including SAP GUI for Windows (where feasible)
  • Edge Browser Extensions

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

  • Rounded Corners Windows design, Win 11 style (see screenshots)
  • Administrator tools for data and settings management via command line
  • support report "batch" to grab support data in cases of a non-launching SAP Business Client
  • Autocomplete capabilities in Quicklaunch
  • Restore tabs-mechanism (in case of crash or to re-establish past sessions)
  • Non-alphabetic workspaces order in System Selector
  • Show connection info for read-only connections in System Selector
  • Advanced Connection filtering in System Selector
  • Launch and manage intents via Javascript (for FLP connection)
  • Browser like-UI changes, Zoom, Share and Favorites buttons in QL

What will you get?

As soon as the program starts (this is expected for end of September), you will get:

  • Access to the most current version of SAP Business Client 8.10 and SAP GUI for Windows 8.10* for test purposes
  • A document with additional information on the new features
  • A contact within the SAP Business Client development team that you can use to provide feedback to us or ask questions you may have

We would love to hear from you.

 

Kind regards,

Sandra Thimme
Product Manager SAP Business Client

entry.title: Re: Documentation for DDIC tables of the DRC module
entry.content:
Hi Martin,

The DRC table SRF_REP_RUN_DATA stores the preview data—in simpler terms, the data of the generated documents (depending on the provided data source in the document mappings).

If you want to search for a specific data source, here’s an example of how to backtrack:

In the Define Statutory Reports application, you can search for your report definition (e.g., DE_VAT_ADV_RTN_*, depending on the version). There, you will find the document DE_VAT_ADV_RTN_DOCUMENT (Advance VAT Return). In the mapping screen, under Data Source and Corresponding Value, you can find the exact source.

For your use case, if you want to directly use the SRF_REP_RUN_DATA table for your consumption, it will be a bit complicated, as you will have to join multiple tables to map the generated data corresponding to each document schema element.

I would suggest taking reference from the document mapping and using the query provided in the data source. For many elements, the value will simply be a ‘Literal,’ meaning a constant value. If you want to know more about any specific query, you can check the Query Definition, where you will find the exact source (table, CDS view, class methods, etc.).

If you still want to go with generated data, you can fetch the run details from 'SRF_REP_RUN', document details from 'SRF_REP_RUN_DOC', and the generated data from 'SRF_REP_RUN_DATA', in the provided parent-child hierarchy and document schema elements details from the 'SRF_ELEMENT' table to map each element with the generated data. 

Thanks & Regards,
Anuj

entry.title: Professional Services in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508
entry.content:
Welcome to your one-stop shop to learn and share knowledge about SAP's ready-to-run public Cloud ERP software solution.  

SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition is part of SAP Business Suite that brings AI, data, and applications together into a fully integrated system. This community is open for anyone in the Cloud ERP ecosystem–customers, partners, and SAP experts. 

In this blog post I’d like to outline the innovations for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 in the area of Professional Services. These are the topics that are covered:

  • New Resource Request Status (6JO) 
  • Configurable profit center and partner profit center derivation in new, resource-related intercompany billing (16T, 4AN)
  • Deprecation of Old Resource-Related Intercompany Billing (16T, 4AN) 
  • Enhance Launchpad for Professional Services Project Manager (J11)
  • Additional insight to project manager about purchase requisitions and work packages of professional services projects (J11) 
  • UI Adaptation for Project Control-Professional Services (J11) 
  • AI-assisted Note Corrections for Project Billing (4E9) 
  • Ability to Recognize Revenue based on a Current Foreign Currency Exchange Rate in Fixed-Price Customer Projects (1IL) 
  • Additional Plan Sources in Revenue Recognition for Customer Projects (1IL) 

 

Check out my video to get a glimpse of the new features:

 

New Resource Request Status (6JO)

This functionality is part of the Resource Management functionality on the BTP which works hand in hand with the project management in SAP S/4HANA Cloud. In the Staff Resource Requests app, resource managers can now manually set the resource request status to “fulfilled” for bookkeeping purposes. This is helpful when resource requests are only partially staffed to mark these as fully staffed. Besides the automatic determined staffing status, they are able to re-set status from fully staffed manually back to open or to fully staffed. This will help to put focus on requests which really require attention. This status is also available in the request API.

Have a look at this demo to get a better understanding of the system:

For even more details, please have a look at the entry of this topic on SAP Help Portal.

 

Configurable profit center and partner profit center derivation in new, resource-related intercompany billing (16T, 4AN)

You can now also configure a profit center or partner profit center derivation logic in the new resource-related intercompany billing whereby the profit center derived during the new resource-related intercompany billing can be based on the profit center derived from the related intercompany sales order, in which case the partner profit center will be empty. 

There are several benefits that come hand in hand with this innovation, for one you have a detailed profit center reporting on billing documents and accounts payable and also your configuration can be adjusted to meet different reporting requirements, offering flexibility.

The profit center value is derived for every posting during the preparation of Billing Document Request (RICR). There is a new SSCUI to activate profit center derivation based on the Intercompany Sales Order Item (107061).

If the configuration is unchecked, which is the case by default, the profit center derivation is based on the partner object of the posting.If the configuration is checked, the profit center derivation is based on the intercompany sales order item. The Partner Profit Center field will be empty in this case.

For even more details, please have a look at the entry of this topic on SAP Help Portal.

 

Deprecation of Old Resource-Related Intercompany Billing (16T, 4AN)

 The old version of the Resource-Related Intercompany Billing is deprecated. The new Resource Related Intercompany Billing is the successor providing greater flexibility and transparency. It is recommended to use the new Resource-Related Intercompany Billing. In case you have not yet moved from the old solution to the new solution, we recommend doing so. In case of any questions please feel free to reach out, we are happy to support you in this journey.

There are multiple added values with the new solution, such as flexibility to configure the determination of material that influence the invoice structure, enhanced traceability of billing data with released CDS views, enablement of end-to-end extensibility, enablement of Brazil localization, and removal of restriction on using a single Intercompany Sales Order for a Sender and Receiver company code combination, during billing.

It is a easily switch to the new Resource-Related Intercompany Billing by activating the configuration setting New Resource Related Intercompany Billing activation (ID: 106897). You can continue to use the same “Generate Intercompany Billing” application and scope items after transitioning from the old to the new Resource-Related Intercompany  to process the existing and new intercompany CO journal entries.

For customer tenants with newly activated scope items for Resource-Related Intercompany Billing will have the new Resource-Related Intercompany Billing set as the default.

For even more details, please have a look at the entry of this topic on SAP Help Portal.

 

Enhance Launchpad for Professional Services Project Manager (J11)

There is a new Space template that provides more efficient, user-friendly, and focused experience of SAP Fiori launchpad for professional services project managers. This enhanced role template now includes access to “Project Billing” application, financial reports such as project financial booklet, “Purchase Requisition” application and “Manage collaborative projects” application.

The launchpad space has been split into the following pages for easier navigation

  • Overview
  • Project Planning and Execution
  • Project Billing and Financials
  • Project Administration

The existing space template 'SAP_BR_PROJECT_MANAGER_PROF', assigned to the business role 'Project Manager - Professional Services (SAP_BR_PROJECT_MANAGER_PROF)', has been enhanced by adding new catalogs and organizing apps across multiple pages, such as Overview, Project Planning and Execution, Project Billing and Financials, and Project Administration, to reduce launchpad clutter. 

Ultimately this new structure leads to increased usability, productivity, and satisfaction.

For even more details, please have a look at the entry of this topic on SAP Help Portal.

 

Additional insight to project manager about purchase requisitions and work packages of professional services projects (J11)

You should already familiar with the “Project Control – Professional Services” application, as we have been mentioning innovations in this app in several of the previous releases and we are continuing to extend the functionality there.

With this release we bring project managers direct insights into work packages and purchase requisition related to professional services projects. This has not been part of this app before and will allow key users to have access to even more information.

Just some examples of the added insights are:

  • Planned efforts, expenses, and costs and revenue
  • Actual efforts, expenses, and costs
  • Cost and efforts estimated to completion & estimated at completion
  • Purchase requisition and Purchase order related insights which are assigned to professional services project

This brings us even closer to providing one single entry point for project managers that gives an overview of project-related information and access to related apps and actions.

Have a look at this demo to get a better understanding of the system:

For even more details, please have a look at the entry of this topic on SAP Help Portal.

 

UI Adaptation for Project Control-Professional Services (J11)

The next innovation for the Project Control – Professional Services app is new UI adaptation functionality. Enhancement allows you to create an app variant of the app using SAPUI5 flexibility features in a modification-free way. With an application variant, you can extend the original code to define changes that fulfil the specific business requirements of different business roles, user groups, organizational units, and countries. For example, you might want to create an application variant to simplify and streamline a specific process by hiding fields not required by casual users, visualizing data as a chart, or changing a responsive table to a grid table to make information easier to process.

This means that key users will now be able to customize applications for specific roles or departments, ensuring that each user group has access to the most relevant information and functionality specifically for them. This means for example to add new data sections or new visual elements. They can also change the outbound navigation within an app, for example defining navigation to custom price maintenance app or change the OData Service for UI adaptation project, this ensures that access to app from is consistent and secure.

In this demo you can see a very simple example of adding in a notes tab in one variant of the app, just to show you how this can look like. Please also make sure to have a look at the release blog from Katharina Stopf. There you will be able to find a more detailed video of the step-to-step process of generating this example.

Have a look at this demo to get a better understanding of the system:

Extended demo version:

For even more details, please have a look at this introduction video and tutorial for key users.

 

AI-assisted Note Corrections for Project Billing (4E9)

This feature in the Manage Project Billing app assists billing specialists by proposing grammatically correct smart suggestions for the notes of Time and Expenses items in Project Billing Request. This functionality will reduce the time spend manually reviewing numerous notes and accelerates the notes review process, which improves efficiency and accuracy in the billing process. ​It gives the option to either bulk review, which means to review up to 500 note corrections with a single click of the Smart Notes button or do a selective review, so choose up to 500 notes or specific Project Billing Request items for note proposals.​ The AI proposed notes which are saved are also available in the Invoice providing greater clarity.

In the demo you are able to see, that when a billing specialist enters the Manage Project Billing app, they select a billing element and click on the prepare billing button. In the next screen they are able to see the time and expense items including all their notes. When clicking on the  smart notes button you can find the proposed notes section. On the top it will always say that this was created with AI just to ensure the transparency to the users. After using this feature to simplify the review process, the billing specialist can submit and follow the next steps in the billing process as usual.

Have a look at this demo to get a better understanding of the system:

For even more details, please have a look at the entry of this topic on SAP Help Portal.

 Please remember that Andreas Hammerschmidt updates his detailed blog “Project Billing for Customer Projects in SAP S/4HANA Cloud” with every release, so you can find a comprehensive overview of the functionality there.

 

Ability to Recognize Revenue based on a Current Foreign Currency Exchange Rate in Fixed-Price Customer Projects (1IL)

 This is especially interesting for countries that tend to experience frequent changes in their currency rate, whereby the foreign exchange rate of the company code to the project currency consistently fluctuates. The revenue recognition key SPFCFX is internally linked to a new event-based revenue recognition currency handling method which uses the project or object currency as the principal currency. In order to leverage this functionality, you need to use the revenue recognition key SPFCFX for the integration with Customer Projects with fixed-price projects to provide revenue recognition data based on current foreign exchange rates for customer projects planned with a foreign currency. 

Let’s have a look at an example. We have a project in India, which means the company code currency is Indian rupee, but we bill in US dollars. Let's assume the exchange rate is changing, in period one it's 1 to 100 in period 5 it's 1 to 120.

The billing plan amount is 100000 US dollars.

In period one we take the current rate based on the project creation date. Let's assume there are some cost postings, and the percentage of completion is 10%. Then the revenue would be 10,000 US dollars.

But the realized revenue in the company code is 1 million Indian rupee.

Let's first look at how the system is handling it today with the with the SPFC standard key.

The rate which is taken into consideration is still based on the project creation date. Let's assume there are additional postings which lead to a percentage of completion of 20% realized revenue, so 20,000 US dollars realized. But the realized revenue in the company code currency is still 1 million rupees.

The new revenue recognition key is considering the first day of the period 5. So here it's 1 to 120.

Instead of realizing revenue and company code currency, Indian rupee of 1 million, we are realizing 1.2 million. The Work in progress overall still is 2.2 million.

To summarize the foreign currency valuation is currently taking reference from the frozen rate versus the end of the month rate. However, with the new revenue recognition key it will take first day of the period rate versus the end of the same month.

For even more details, please have a look at the entry of this topic on SAP Help Portal.

 

Additional Plan Sources in Revenue Recognition for Customer Projects (1IL)

 With this release, you can now use additional plan sources in Event-Based Revenue Recognition for the revenue recognition keys for fixed price projects with the cost-based percentage of completion method (revenue recognition keys SPFC and SPFCTR). This will help. This will empower your financial processes with expanded configuration options, enabling more tailored cost and revenue planning based on project-specific requirements​.

It covers the following:

  • SPFC (fixed-price cost-based percentage of completion):​
  • 305: Confirmed estimate at completion (EAC) from the customer projects planning tools and revenues from the actual sales and distribution (SD) billing schedule​
  • 500: Cost and revenue planning of all objects from ACDOCP based on a configured plan category​
    • SPFCTR (fixed-price cost-based percentage of completion and target revenue):​
  • 305: Confirmed estimate at completion (EAC) from the customer projects planning tools and revenues from the actual sales and distribution (SD) billing schedule​

For even more details, please have a look at the entry of this topic on SAP Help Portal.

 

More Information

If you are interested in the latest and greatest blog posts on Professional Services, please have a look at my collection blog and also take a look at the Community page for Professional Services.

Watch the Replays of Our SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2502 Early Release Series!   

From July 21 to July 25, we hosted a series of 21 compelling live sessions to highlight the exciting innovations shipped with the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 release. Missed the live sessions? We've got you covered! Take advantage of the entire series or pick and choose the sessions most relevant to you. You will find the recording and presentation for Enterprise Portfolio and Project Management as well as 20 other topics of interest. Don't miss this chance and watch them on demand – anywhere, anytime. 

  

Find All of Our Assets   

We at Cloud ERP Product Success offer a service as versatile as our product itself. Check out the numerous offerings our team has created for you below:
